message_payload.content: What is heavier, a kilo of feathers or a pound of steel?
A kilogram of feathers is heavier than a pound of steel. This is because a kilogram is a larger unit of measurement than a pound. To be precise, 1 kilogram is approximately 2.20462 pounds.

Sure, it's all about comparing the weights using the same unit of measurement. 

As I said, 1 kilogram is equivalent to 2.20462 pounds. So, when you compare a kilogram (of anything, feathers, steel, etc.) to a pound (of anything), the kilogram will always be heavier. 

So, a kilogram of feathers is heavier than a pound of steel, not because of what they are made of, but because a kilogram is a larger unit of mass than a pound.
